Models¶

Introduction¶

The simulations work by solving kinetic models, i.e. systems of rate equations. In the steady-state, the time derivatives are set equal to zero, allowing an exact algebraic solution. For time-resolved simulations, the rate equations are integrated to obtain numerical excited-state populations as a function of time.

Diagrams¶

Draw some pictures of the different models, showing states and rates!

Example¶

m = timeresolvedmodels.Merrifield()
# set the rate constants
m.kGEN = 1.8
m.kSF = 0.05
m.k_SF = 0.05
m.kDISS = 5e-3
m.kTTA = 1e-23
m.kRELAX = 0
m.kSSA = 0
m.kTTNR = 1e-5
m.kTNR = 1e-5
m.kSNR = 0.06
# set the initial excitation density
m.G = 1e17
# simulate
m.simulate()
# get some results
S1 = m.simulation_results['S1']

Time-Resolved Models API¶

class tripletpairs.kineticmodelling.timeresolvedmodels.MerrifieldExplicit1TT[source]¶

A class for time-resolved simulations using a modified version of Merrifield’s model.

The model explicity includes the \(^1(TT)\) state, and allows for decay of a single triplet in a \((T..T)\) state.

states¶

The names of the excited state species.

Type

list of str

rates¶

The names of the different rate constants in the model.

Type

list of str

model_name¶

The name of the model.

Type

str

G¶

The initial exciton density. Units of per volume.

Type

float

initial_weighting¶

Dictionary of (str, float) pairs. Key is the state name (str) and value is its initial weight (float). The default is {‘S1’: 1}.

Type

dict

t_step¶

The first time step taken by the simulation, thereafter the step will increase geometrically.

Type

float

t_end¶

The last time point in the simulation.

Type

float

num_points¶

The number of time points to compute the simulation at.

Type

int

kSF¶

Rate constant for \(S_1\rightarrow ^1(TT)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

k_SF¶

Rate constant for \(^1(TT)\rightarrow S_1\). Units of per time.

Type

float

kHOP¶

Rate constant for \(^1(TT)\rightarrow (T..T)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

k_HOP¶

Rate constant for \((T..T)\rightarrow ^1(TT)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

kHOP2¶

Rate constant for \((T..T)\rightarrow2\times T_1\). Units of per time.

Type

float

kTTA¶

Rate constant for \(2\times T_1\rightarrow (T..T) or ^1(TT) or S_1\). See MerrifieldExplicit1TT.TTA_channel. Units of volume per time.

Type

float

kRELAX¶

Rate constant for mixing between the \((T..T)\) states. Units of per time.

Type

float

kSSA¶

Singlet-singlet annihilation rate constant. Units of volume per time.

Type

float

kSNR¶

Rate constant for the decay of \(S_1\). Units of per time.

Type

float

kTTNR¶

Rate constant for the decay of \(^1(TT)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

kTNR¶

Rate constant for the decay of \(T_1\), or one of the triplets in \((T..T)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

cslsq¶

1D array containing the overlap factors between the 9 \((T..T)\) states and the singlet.

Type

numpy.ndarray

TTA_channel¶

Index determining the fate of free triplets. 1 gives \(2\times T_1\rightarrow (T..T)\). 2 gives \(2\times T_1\rightarrow ^1(TT)\). 3 gives \(2\times T_1\rightarrow S_1\).

Type

int

simulation_results¶

Produced by simulate(). Keys are the excited-state names (str), values the simulated populations (numpy.ndarray).

Type

dict

simulate()¶

Perform the simulation.

Returns

Return type

None.

view_timepoints()¶

Produce a plot showing the distribution of times, print the first and last 5.

Returns

Return type

None.

class tripletpairs.kineticmodelling.timeresolvedmodels.Bardeen[source]¶

A class for steady-state simulations using a modified version of Merrifield’s model.

The model does not include free triplets. Instead Merrifield’s \((TT)\) states can separate to form 9 \((T..T)\) states which can undergo spin relaxation. This is an approximation to triplet-diffusion in the limit of low excitation density.

states¶

The names of the excited state species.

Type

list of str

rates¶

The names of the different rate constants in the model.

Type

list of str

model_name¶

The name of the model.

Type

str

G¶

The initial exciton density. Units of per volume.

Type

float

initial_weighting¶

Dictionary of (str, float) pairs. Key is the state name (str) and value is its initial weight (float). The default is {‘S1’: 1}.

Type

dict

t_step¶

The first time step taken by the simulation, thereafter the step will increase geometrically.

Type

float

t_end¶

The last time point in the simulation.

Type

float

num_points¶

The number of time points to compute the simulation at.

Type

int

kSF¶

Rate constant for \(S_1\rightarrow (TT)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

k_SF¶

Rate constant for \((TT)\rightarrow S_1\). Units of per time.

Type

float

kHOP¶

Rate constant for \((TT)\rightarrow (T..T)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

k_HOP¶

Rate constant for \((T..T)\rightarrow (TT)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

kRELAX¶

Rate constant for mixing between the \((T..T)\) states. Units of per time.

Type

float

kSSA¶

Singlet-singlet annihilation rate constant. Units of volume per time.

Type

float

kSNR¶

Rate constant for the decay of \(S_1\). Units of per time.

Type

float

kTTNR¶

Rate constant for the decay of \((TT)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

kSPIN¶

Rate constant for the decay of \((T..T)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

cslsq¶

1D array containing the overlap factors between the 9 \((T..T)\) states and the singlet.

Type

numpy.ndarray

simulation_results¶

Produced by simulate(). Keys are the excited-state names (str), values the simulated populations (numpy.ndarray).

Type

dict

None.

Steady-State Models API¶

class tripletpairs.kineticmodelling.steadystatemodels.MerrifieldExplicit1TT[source]¶

A class for steady-state simulations using a modified version of Merrifield’s model.

The model explicity includes the \(^1(TT)\) state, and allows for decay of a single triplet in a \((T..T)\) state.

The names of the excited state species.

Type

list of str

rates¶

Type

str

initial_weighting¶

Dictionary of (str, float) pairs. Key is the state name (str) and value is its initial weight (float).

Type

dict

G¶

The exciton generation rate for initial_state. Units of per volume per time.

Type

float

kSF¶

Rate constant for \(S_1\rightarrow ^1(TT)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

k_SF¶

Rate constant for \(^1(TT)\rightarrow S_1\). Units of per time.

Type

float

float

Rate constant for the decay of \(^1(TT)\). Units of per time.

Type

float

Type

float

Type

numpy.ndarray

simulation_results¶

Produced by simulate(). Keys are the excited-state names (str), values the simulated populations (float).

Type

dict

Returns

Return type

None.

class tripletpairs.kineticmodelling.steadystatemodels.Bardeen[source]¶

A class for steady-state simulations using a modified version of Merrifield’s model.

The model does not include free triplets. Instead Merrifield’s \((TT)\) states can separate to form 9 \((T..T)\) states which can undergo spin relaxation. This is an approximation to triplet-diffusion in the limit of low excitation density.
